newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Nikkei futures plunge through 19,000.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Nikkei futures plunge through 19,000.

text.p: SIMEX Nikkei futures closed at their lowest level in more than a year on Tuesday as depressed sentiment and a bearish technical outlook combined to drag the market down by almost 500 points.
The benchmark Nikkei 225 March contract finished at 18,960 against its previous settlement at 19,455, after hitting a low of 18,860.
Dealers said stop-loss sales were triggered below the psychologically important 19,000 points level pulling the March Nikkei sharply lower.
The yen's recovery against the dollar was largely ignored by the market, which on Monday used the dollar's rise to a near 46-month high of 117 yen as a reason to sell the Nikkei.
The dollar was quoted at around 115.48/58 yen at 0830 GMT after a slew of comments by Japanese officials calling for more stability in forex rates.
"We couldn't get above the small intra-day resistance of 19,550-19,590 so the market just tried the bottom and pushed through it," said a trader with a local institution.
He said the March Nikkei could bounce back from the 18,550-18,750 support region but on the longer-term charts it looked set to test 17,550 eventually.
"The whole downtrend will only be able to change if we can see 20,000 again. But that looks tough. There are so many (resistance) levels before that," he added.
